titleStmt.title: Englands hallelu-jah. Or, Great Brittaines gratefull retribution, for Gods gratious benediction In our many and most famous deliuerances, since the halcyon-dayes of euer-blessed Queene Elizabeth, to these present times. Together, with diuers of Dauids Psalmes, according to the French metre and measures. By I:V
titleStmt.author: Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.

titleStmt.title: Englands hallelu-jah. Or, Great Brittaines gratefull retribution, for Gods gratious benediction In our many and most famous deliuerances, since the halcyon-dayes of euer-blessed Queene Elizabeth, to these present times. Together, with diuers of Dauids Psalmes, according to the French metre and measures. By I:V
titleStmt.author: Vicars, John, 1579 or 80-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Tho: Purfoot, for Henry Seile, and are to be sold at the Tygers Head in S. Paules Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and the Bodleian Library.
Filmed copy from the Huntington Library is incomplete; quires A-B, E-F, C1, C2r, and D8v of Bodleian Library copy spliced at end.
